content.description: Climb the bolted arete to chains
content.location: It’s the bolted arete high up the steep ramp that starts at the creek and leads right to the Wall and prominent arete.

climbs.name: Monster Trucks and Chili Corn Dogs

content.description: Monster Trucks and Chili Corn Dogs follows a short, slightly overhung arete feature at Eurovision. After 15 feet of 4th class slab to a ledge, stem up the dihedral to clip the first bolt. Though the dihedral is climbable, we chose to climb in from the right with an engaging, somewhat slopey traverse until you’re over the first bolt. The bolting is very friendly and at least one bolt can be bypassed by clipping a little high. Do some compression-type moves between small crimps on the face and slopers on the arete. There are no real rests, but there are a couple of incut holds to shake a hand on. The route goes quick! All of the holds are super solid and the movement is quite unique. Probably 11d/12a.
content.location: Follow the directions under Eurovision sub-area. This route is accessible from below the snake-like crack (5.8 trad) that can be seen from the pullout.

content.description: Eurovision is a small collection of routes on a short cliff, just East of the Pond on the South side of the road. One older sport route (apparently 5.10+) already exists so it is possible that this area has another name. Aaron Collins has been establishing the new routes, including a couple of quality 5.8s. Just right of them is Monster Trucks and Chili Corn Dogs.From what we can gather, Wounded Knee Wall is just across the wash on the same side of the road.
